data.name: Liqour Barrel Aged Outta Kilter
data.description: The rich and malty character of our Outta Kilter scotch style red ale is masterfully complemented by barrel aging, as the “angel’s share” slowly evaporates resulting in a wonderful concentrating of flavors. The full flavor experience goes one step further with the vanillin undertones from the oak wood of the barrel, adding a savory, satisfying depth of flavor, ultimately creating a wonderful sensory experience. Barrels used in each batch can be determined by the cap color on the bottle. Red Cap - American Brandy Barrels.

style.name: Wood- and Barrel-Aged Beer
style.description: A wood- or barrel-aged beer is any lager, ale or hybrid beer, either a traditional style or a unique experimental beer that has been aged for a period of time in a wooden barrel or in contact with wood. This beer is aged with the intention of imparting the particularly unique character of the wood and/or what has previously been in the barrel. New wood character can be characterized as a complex blend of vanillin and/or other unique wood character, but wood aged is not necessarily synonymous with imparting wood-flavors. Used sherry, rum, bourbon, scotch, port, wine and other barrels are often used, imparting complexity and uniqueness to beer. Ultimately a balance of flavor, aroma and mouthfeel are sought with the marriage of new beer with wood and/or barrel flavors. Beers in this style may or may not have Brettanomyces character. Brewers when entering this category should specify type of barrel and/or wood used and any other special treatment or ingredients used. Competition managers may create style subcategories to differentiate between high alcohol and low alcohol beers and very dark and lighter colored beer as well as for fruit beers and non-fruit beers. Competitions may develop guidelines requesting brewers to specify what kind of wood (new or used oak, other wood varieties) and/or barrel (whiskey, port, sherry, wine, etc.) was used in the process. The brewer may be asked to explain the special nature (wood used, base beer style(s) and achieved character) of the beer.

breweries.name: Hoppin' Frog Brewery
breweries.description:
Hoppin’ Frog is a small, hands-on brewery making very flavorful beers in the most flavorful beer styles. We brew high quality beers with an uncompromising focus on detail, from the ingredient selection to the brewing process. A specially designed JV Northwest brewing system creates more flavorful beers by allowing more barley to be used in the brewing process.  We also use a special bottling machine that keeps the beer fresher, and extends storage times compared to other conventional microbrewery bottling machines. This is very beneficial to retain all the character of these flavorful styles of beer.

Hoppin’ Frog is the concept of owner and established brewmaster Fred Karm, who has designed and produced more award-winning beers than any other professional brewer in Ohio since 2000. All of these awards were won at the 2 most prestigious contests in the world, including the Great American Beer Festival and the World Beer Cup. Mr. Karm has been a brewer of specialty beers since 1994, a life-long Akron, Ohio resident, and is a graduate of the University Of Akron.

breweries.name: Allagash Brewing Company
breweries.description: Allagash Brewing Company was founded by Rob Tod in 1995 as a one man operation dedicated to hand crafting the best Belgian inspired beers in the world. The first beer brewed was Allagash White, a spiced wheat beer and now our company flagship available in 17 states. We love beer, we love working with each other, we continually push the limits of beer and ourselves, and we grow as a profitable and sustainable company (and as individuals), without compromising our values or purpose. This passion has helped us push Allagash to the forefront of the growing Belgian beer category. We’ve won countless awards for our beer (11 medals including 4 gold since 2002 at The Great American Beer Festival & 10 medals including gold & silver in 2012 since 1998 at the bi-annual World Beer Cup), and received acclaim in the press (Gourmet, Bon Appetit, Men’s Journal, GQ, The Wall Street Journal and Saveur). But perhaps best of all, everyone in the Allagash family loves working here.

data.name: Lord Phunk
data.description: Crazy things happen in barrels, especially when we brew with microbes. These little buggers create their own ecosystem & give us wonderfully complex beer. The use of Lactobacillus creates a lower PH which produces that wonderful puckering note that Sour Flemish Red Ales are known for. The combination of tart cherry and vanilla are showcased in this red wine barrelled pHunky-fresh beer.

breweries.name: Burley Oak Craft Brewery
breweries.description:
Hi there! We have been hard at work building this brewery keeping in mind sustainable practices and using local materials and craftsmen. We love our town of Berlin, Maryland and hope you join us in our taproom for a couple of pints and growlers. Our goal is to produce distinctive beers whose quaility is unsurpassed using new and traditional brewing methods.

Why "Burley Oak?"

The inspiration for our name Burley Oak Brewing Company was derived from the name of the town, our traditional brewing methods and the history of our brewhouse. 

Berlin, Maryland in Wikipedia 
The town of Berlin had its start around the 1790s, part of the Burley Plantation, a 300-acre (1.2 km2) land grant dating back to 1677. The name Berlin is believed to be derived from a contraction of "Burleigh Inn", a tavern located at the crossroads of the Philadelphia Post Road (now South Main Street) and Sinepuxent Road (Tripoli Street).

It just so happens, that our building was originally a Cooperage - making oak barrels to fill with local produce and seafood to ship off to Baltimore in the early 1900's. And we are bringing barrels back to the building, aiding us in the aging of our hand-crafted ales.

breweries.name: Shoreline Brewery
breweries.description: Shoreline Brewery is a brewery and restaurant located near the shores of Lake Michigan in Michigan City, Indiana. Twelve beers are always on tap, including the World Beer Cup Award winning Beltaine Scottish Ale and Singing Sands Oatmeal Stout, and seasonal beers such as Samuel Jacksons Black IPA, Bavarian Bombshell Black Lager, and the Barrel Aged Imperial Stout Lost Sailor. In the eight years of existence, Shoreline Brewery has evolved and grown into so much more than just a brewery.

data.name: Love Child No. 3
data.description:
Boulevard's Love Child Series of "wild" ales are barrel-aged with such boisterous cultures as Lactobaccillus and Brettanomyces. These wayward offspring can prove so complex that we employ gauges on the label to convey the intensity of three key personality traits, Funk, Sour, and Fruit, presenting a picture of the ale at the time it was released. It will change as it ages, but don't we all?

Oak barrels were used to age the majority of beer used for Love Child No. 3—with beer aged from 16 months to nearly six years. Another portion of the beer spent 11 months in stainless tanks, souring on Lactobacillus. While very tart, the sourness is short-lived and the beer finishes dry with a trace of oak.

breweries.name: Paradox Beer Company
breweries.description: Modern brewing processes collide, headlong, into ancient beer. Therein lies the Paradox. The creative forces behind Paradox Beer have explored, wholehartedly, all facets of beer, brewing and drinking and have found the Bedrock of Beer. When all else is removed, Beeris Alchemey sprinkled with Paradigm dashed on the hopes of Artistic Grandeur. In our case we took Wayward Beers, unruly at best, and Bound them in the confines of Experienced Oak in the hopes that the sum would be greater than the parts... A lofty goal! One that the human condition aspires to?

breweries.name: Odd Side Ales
breweries.description: ​Welcome to Odd Side Ales, one of the fastest growing breweries in Michigan. Born in an old piano factory in downtown Grand Haven, Michigan, Odd Side Ales first opened its doors in March 2010. We've grown steadily since that first brew, but have never lost sight of our initial goal: to create a variety of complex beers, each with its own unique flavor. To that end, we strive to craft unusual beers that will make your taste buds dance. Whether you're looking for the perfect IPA or something ... just a little different, we've got the beer for you.

data.name: LYRA
data.description: This Entrepôt series "warehouse ale" was brewed with a blend of pilsner and white wheat malts and hopped with a blend of magnum, mt. hood, and nelson sauvin hops. It was then aged in cabernet barrels for five months and hand bottled in cork-and-cage 375 ml. bottles.

data.name: Maple Barrel Aged FMIS
data.description:
Brewed with loads of roasted and black malts and over two gallons of Vt maple syrup per barrel, this beauty was carefully ages for many months in Sapling Maple Liquor oak barrels from Saxon’s River Distillery in Brattleboro, VT. This rich and complex beer will mature for many months.
Made for sub-zero nights and pairings with decadent desserts.

breweries.name: Lawson's Finest Liquids
breweries.description: Lawson’s Finest Liquids, LLC is based in Warren, Vermont and distributes small, custom batches of unique beer through their exclusive wholesale distributor, The Beer Guy, LLC. Sean Lawson, founder and brewer, has been an avid home brewer for nearly twenty years, with numerous award winning recipes. Lawson’s Finest, with a small batch system, can custom craft specialty beers for establishments and events. Limited in availability by design, these rare beers can only be found near the Mad River Valley of Vermont.

breweries.name: New Holland Brewing Company
breweries.description:
New Holland Brewing Company’s deep roots in the craft industry go back to 1997. Our role as an integral member of the artisan approach is something we take seriously, yet engage lightheartedly.

We believe the art of craft lives in fostering rich experiences for our customers, through creating authentic beer, spirits and food while providing great service. Recognized for our creativity and artistry, our mission to improve the lives of craft consumers everywhere is seen in our diverse, balanced collection of beer and spirits.

data.name: MARK aged in 2014
data.description:
MARK Oak is brewed on hay and other local produce from Herslev. It is aged in wood at the port wine casks, which has been used to store both whiskey and star BREW earlier. 

It is vinous, fresh and tart and have clear tones of taniner from the barrels, which gives a round and full-bodied rounding on a fresh and tangy BREW.
data.foodPairings: MARK Oak with its acidity will give good response to fatty fish and fried and grilled poultry with skin.

breweries.name: Herslev Bryghus
breweries.description:
Herslev Brewery is a microbrewery located on a farm with its own farm in the village Herslev near Roskilde Fjord. 

We produce hand-brewed beer without computer automation. We use instead the eyes, nose and palate, and follows the beer from day to day. The key words of our production is quality, pure ingredients and full traceability. 

We make beer, we can enjoy, and let the seasonal time inspire us in the development of new, intense flavors.

data.name: Matanuska Thunder Funk
data.description:
ALASKANA series:
 Eight beers will debut in 2014 but this series is designed as an ongoing experience to represent “life in Alaska.” Additional beers will be created in this series and our favorites will be re-produced.

“As in all areas of the world, Alaska has its own vernacular — a unique array of terms that describe life in the Great Land. Inspired by these quirky terms, Midnight Sun is presenting some favorites in the form of beer. So whether you live in Alaska or Outside, let your taste buds interpret our language via your glass.

MATANUSKA THUNDER FUNK:
 Playing with the name of a high potency strain of marijuana from the Matanuska Valley region of Alaska, we changed one letter to call our beer “Matanuska Thunder Funk.” And funky this beer is! Beginning as a Belgian-style Saison, MTF was transferred to oak barrels and inoculated with Brettanomyces for a long-many months. This batch created a mother funk, which will be blended with a fresh batch of saison to balance and soften the grassy/green apple/sweaty horse blanket character of Brettanomyces. MTF is heavy on the funk in a way laid back way.

breweries.name: Midnight Sun Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Since firing up its brew kettle in 1995, Midnight Sun Brewing Company has become a serious yet creative force on the American brewing front. From concept to glass, Midnight Sun relies on an "art marries science" approach, mixing tradition with innovation, to design and craft bold, distinctive beers for Alaska...and beyond.

We at Midnight Sun find inspiration in the untamed spirit and rugged beauty of the Last Frontier and develop unique beers with equally appealing names and labels. But the company’s true focus remains in its dedication to producing consistently high-quality beers that provide exciting flavor and satisfying refreshment in all seasons.

From our extreme Pacific Northwest locale, we offer our wonderful beers on draft and in 22-ounce bottles throughout Alaska. Some of these beers are also distributed in Washington, Idaho, Oregon and California. We invite you to visit our hardworking brewery and retail Loft in South Anchorage every chance you get!

data.name: Mélange No. 1
data.description: Mélange No 1 - A blend of our award winning Oude Tart Flemish red with our infamous Black Tuesday imperial Stout.  This beer is a true testament to our Mélange series and has well earned the title of #1.  The tangy dark fruit flavors of Oude Tart twist themselves with the chocolaty sweetness of Black Tuesday in a way that fools the palate into thinking you are truly drinking two great, yet widely different beers at the same time.

breweries.name: The Bruery
breweries.description:
A boutique craft brewery located in Orange County, California specializing in experimental and barrel aged beer. Our name is a fusion of 'brewery' with our family name, Rue.

Our calling is to create beers with character and depth using the simplest and purest of means. We do not filter or pasteurize our beers. Most of our bottled beers gain carbonation through bottle conditioning, allowing carbonation to naturally occur through a secondary bottle fermentation. We strive to use unconventional ingredients, and we will proudly state what we put in our beers.

data.name: Minor Dementia
data.description: Temporary Insanity becomes Minor Dementia. We age our russian style imperial stout in an oak bourbon barrel. The result is a beer that pours thick and pitch black, while the edges exhibit ruby highlights. The flavor is rich and dark, with a nice molasses character balanced out by a woody dryness. Very smooth considering the alcohol level.

breweries.name: Blue and Gray Brewing Co
breweries.description: The Blue & Gray Brewing Co. opened in Fredericksburg on March 17, 2002.  Before that, Fred Red Ale and the Blue & Gray Classic Lager were brewed at other  microbreweries in Virginia. We listened to customer input and perfected our recipes  before we started brewing in Fredericksburg. Blue & Gray Brewing Co. now offers Falmouth American  Pale Ale and Stonewall Stout for a total of four flavors year round. We also offer Spiced  Winter Ale for Thanksgiving through January, Chocolate Raspberry Stout for January-February and  Virginia Hefeweizen Memorial Day through Labor Day.

data.name: Modus Operandi
data.description:
Barrel ageing, blending and using different yeasts, this embraces our love of the unpredictability of wild yeast with the subtlety and complexity of maturation in oak barrels. A study in patience, it takes at least 90 days for the wild yeast to work its magic.

Modus Operandi is the perfect accompaniment to red meat and game dishes, such as duck or venison, a beer that could easily replace a red wine on the dinner table.

A transformation of an old English ale into a beer that is Wildly different. A unique, dark, flavourful beer with a smooth, rich, full body and complex fruit flavours of berries, sweet cherries and tannins.

breweries.name: Wild Beer Co.
breweries.description: Wild Beer, Wild Yeasts, Wild Ingredients, Wild Ideas, Wild Ambitions...

data.name: Modus Vivendi
data.description:
"We believe exceptional brewing stems from imagination and passion, it's not just a process. Never average, every Wild brew is a result of Wild minds conceiving, creating and crafting beers that explore the boundaries of your palate. Brewing doesn't need to be confined by rules, tradition or ingredients; by adding a Wild 5th ingredient or process to our beers we want to give you a truly memorable drinking experience, altering your perceptions and thrilling your taste buds. 

Drink Wildly Different

This is our modus operandi, the beer that says who we are â€” a Wild beer, an untamed beast that thrives on the unpredictability of wild yeast and the subtlety and complexity of maturation in oak. Time is the final ingredient â€” we allow 90 days for the magic of the wild yeast and the oak to transform an old ale into a beer that is Wildly different The aroma is complex:we guarantee you'll find something to grab your attention. The complexity continues on the palate, with citrus tanginess, wild yeast funkiness and woody tannins all jousting for your attention. Over time, other aromas and flavours come out to play: we suggest you buy two, one to drink now the other to keep."

breweries.name: Flat12 Bierwerks
breweries.description:
Flat12 Bierwerks is a production craft brewery based in downtown Indianapolis, USA. Flat12 brews beers for quality, consistency and tradition - with a twist. Our classic line-up includes the Upside Down Blonde, Half Cycle IPA, Pogue's Run Porter and Flat12 Amber Ale. Specialties and seasonals will feature herbs, spices and other experimentations, always geared toward flavor, taste and well-orchestrated subtlety. 

Inspiration: The Flathead 12-cylinder engine - a nod to the automotive and craft brewing heritage of our neighborhood and the early 1900s era when both thrived.

data.name: Múre Revêche
data.description: Burnt orange with a rosé huey, zesty, woody and dark berry aromas, sharp and sour mouthfeel with a smooth buttery oak finish. Brewed with Gambrinus Pilsner, Munich and Wheat, Perle hops and a German yeast strain. Aged for 13 months on French Oak Chardonnay barrels with Brettanomyces lambicus and a Belgian yeast strain, we then added 23 pounds of locally picked blackberries and aged for another 4 months.

breweries.name: Redwood Curtain Brewing
breweries.description:
We desire to share our passion and interest in craft beer with everyone from the first time sipper to the seasoned enthusiast. Providing academic and hands on experiences are a big part of this desire to help people expand and trust their own senses.

All of our handcrafted artisan ales are served and properly aged, to deliver maximum flavor and character. Our expressive beers can be very complex and assertive, but the with the ultimate goal of proper balance. We only use premium domestic and imported malts and hops, Humboldt County water and our multiply yeast strains. You will not find any artificial additives or preservatives in our beers.

We trust that our craft beer and brewing techniques convey our philosophies concerning family, friends, community, education and living life to its fullest. Cheers!

data.name: N.I.B.~
data.description: Imperial Stout aged in a 32 yr. old Rum barrel  for about 9 months with real Vermont maple syrup.   Deep, Dark and Rich, another beer with layers  of flavor.  Definitely not for the faint of heart.  Named in tribute to the nib of Geezer Butler’s pencil?

New wood character can be characterized as a complex blend of vanillin and/or other unique wood character, but wood aged is not necessarily synonymous with imparting wood-flavors. Used sherry, rum, bourbon, scotch, port, wine and other barrels are often used, imparting complexity and uniqueness to beer. Ultimately a balance of flavor, aroma and mouthfeel are sought with the marriage of new beer with wood and/or barrel flavors. Beers in this style may or may not have Brettanomyces character. Brewers when entering this category should specify type of barrel and/or wood used and any other special treatment or ingredients used. Competition managers may create style subcategories to differentiate between high alcohol and low alcohol beers and very dark and lighter colored beer as well as for fruit beers and non-fruit beers. Competitions may develop guidelines requesting brewers to specify what kind of wood (new or used oak, other wood varieties) and/or barrel (whiskey, port, sherry, wine, etc.) was used in the process. The brewer may be asked to explain the special nature (wood used, base beer style(s) and achieved character) of the beer.

breweries.name: Edmund's Oast
breweries.description:
Why Edmund's Oast?

The “Edmund” in the name comes from Edmund Egan, who began producing beer in Charleston after emigrating from England in the 1760s. "Oast” is a kiln used in the drying of hops. 

Edmund's Oast!

beerVariation.name: Naughty 90
beerVariation.description: Our Naughty 90 Oaked IPA was inspired by ocean bound, oak barreled brews of the 1800’s. Packed with hops on a 90-minute schedule, uniquely malted, then aged on a bed of oak, this IPA delivers a taste that is both innovative and timeless.

available.name: Seasonal
available.description: Available at the same time of year, every year.

style.name: American-Style India Pale Ale
style.description: American-style India pale ales are perceived to have medium-high to intense hop bitterness, flavor and aroma with medium-high alcohol content. The style is further characterized by floral, fruity, citrus-like, piney, resinous, or sulfur-like American-variety hop character. Note that one or more of these American-variety hop characters is the perceived end, but the hop characters may be a result of the skillful use of hops of other national origins. The use of water with high mineral content results in a crisp, dry beer. This pale gold to deep copper-colored ale has a full, flowery hop aroma and may have a strong hop flavor (in addition to the perception of hop bitterness). India pale ales possess medium maltiness which contributes to a medium body. Fruity-ester flavors and aromas are moderate to very strong. Diacetyl can be absent or may be perceived at very low levels. Chill and/or hop haze is allowable at cold temperatures. (English and citrus-like American hops are considered enough of a distinction justifying separate American-style IPA and English-style IPA categories or subcategories. Hops of other origins may be used for bitterness or approximating traditional American or English character. See English-style India Pale Ale

breweries.name: Toppling Goliath Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Toppling Goliath is a stealth brewery, flying fast, under the radar. This has been true since the day we quietly opened our first ½ barrel brewery and tap room on the west side of Decorah, IA in 2009. The batches were small but the taste was gigantic, and word spread like wildfire.

Today, our team brews at a larger production facility on the edge of town, regularly experimenting at the tap room to satisfy our craving for new and exciting creations. Numbers are not our game, making a lot of the same beer is just too boring, and life is just too short.

The history of Toppling Goliath lies in the dreams of tomorrow, not the pages of the past. The past is for those who rely on high volume and low value. The past is for those who duplicate rather than design. The past is for cowards. We are forward thinkers and cunning crafters, quietly building our revolution. “Big Beers Brewed in Small Batches.”

data.name: Neapolitan Blown Apart
data.description: Deconstructed Neapolitan beer that we brew in two parts. It is then blended and aged in an oak barrel. It includes hints of berry, vanilla and chocolate like its namesake

breweries.name: BearWaters Brewing Company
breweries.description: BearWaters Brewing Company is located in Waynesville North Carolina in the beautiful Smoky Mountains of Western North Carolina. BearWaters was named in honor of the region's pristine source of mountain water. BearWaters captures the spirit, traditions and majesty of the Great Smoky Mountains. Come enjoy what happens when fearless creativity, maticulous brewing meets natures greatest natural resource.

breweries.name: Allagash Brewing Company
breweries.description: Allagash Brewing Company was founded by Rob Tod in 1995 as a one man operation dedicated to hand crafting the best Belgian inspired beers in the world. The first beer brewed was Allagash White, a spiced wheat beer and now our company flagship available in 17 states. We love beer, we love working with each other, we continually push the limits of beer and ourselves, and we grow as a profitable and sustainable company (and as individuals), without compromising our values or purpose. This passion has helped us push Allagash to the forefront of the growing Belgian beer category. We’ve won countless awards for our beer (11 medals including 4 gold since 2002 at The Great American Beer Festival & 10 medals including gold & silver in 2012 since 1998 at the bi-annual World Beer Cup), and received acclaim in the press (Gourmet, Bon Appetit, Men’s Journal, GQ, The Wall Street Journal and Saveur). But perhaps best of all, everyone in the Allagash family loves working here.

breweries.name: Mikkeller
breweries.description:
The story of Mikkeller is the story of two homebrewers that in a few years went from hobby brewing in the kitchen to national and international recognition.

Since the summer of 2007, Mikkel Borg Bjergsø, has run Mikkeller on his own. Mikkel is a gipsy-brewer, who brews at different breweries in Denmark, around Europe and the United States.

data.name: No Place Like Home
data.description: No Place Like Home is our barrel aged version of Home and our first anniversary beer. NPLH is a double red we aged in Cabernet wine barrels for 6 months. NPLH pours a dark amber with mahogany highlights – aromas of toffee, stone fruit, and oak dominate this rich and beautiful beer. Enjoy now or cellar up to 5 years.

breweries.name: 4 Hands Brewing Company
breweries.description: 4 Hands Brewing Company, located in the LaSalle Park neighborhood, will provide the craft beer enthusiast a handcrafted portfolio inspired by the American craft movement that pushes the limits of creativity. Our barrel -aging program will produce a truly unique line on beers. The use of wine and spirit barrels containing an array of fruit, herbs, and spices in conjunction with wild yeast strains will enhance the flavors to produce a one of a kind beer.

data.name: No. 1 - Brabant Barrel-Aged Wild Ale
data.description: Luscious dark ale fermented with two strains of wild yeast (Brettanomyces) then aged for 8 months in Zinfandel barrels. We hope you enjoy sifting through the vast layers of complexity in this mysterious ale.

breweries.name: Avery Brewing Company
breweries.description: Since 1993 our brewery has been committed to producing eccentric ales and lagers that defy styles or categories. Our products are thoroughly American at heart: blending Old World tradition and expertise with ingenuity, creativity and boldness.

data.nameDisplay: No. 10 - Muscat d'Amour Barrel-Aged Wild Ale
data.description: A lovely amalgamation, awash with the delicate expressions and subtle nuances of solf malt, ripe Muscat Blanc grapes and savory Brett. Aged for 14 months in Chardonnay barrels.

data.name: No. 4 - Dépuceleuse Barrel-Aged Wild Ale
data.description: A 100% brettanomyces fermentation gives this brew lots o' funk throughout, intertwined with pungent elements of sour cherries, delicate aromas of aged wood and a gentle spice imparted the zinfandel barrels. Adventurous and true to the spirit of our Barrel-Aged Series of one-and-done brews, Dépuceleuse is a forceful departure from the mindset of traditional beer style and features a harmony of intriguing flavors. Seductive to the core, she lies patiently in the bottle awaiting the day to deflower virgins of the funky flavors of brettanomyces!

data.name: Northwest Breakfast Stout
data.description: Oatmeal Stout with Coffee. Then we add Woodinville Whiskey Co.Bourbon and a whole mess of toasted oak and age it for 140 days. We change the process up a bit each year but rest assured, this is a massively tasty beer bursting with flavors of coffee, oak, oats, bourbon, toasted things, and chocolate.

breweries.name: Herbert B. Friendly Brewing
breweries.description:
Uniquely Northwest, Herbert B. Friendly Brewing delivers delicious, cold, refreshing beer made by hand with natural ingredients. Each batch is created from scratch for your enjoyment. Quality brews of different styles ranging from the classic to the unconventional. We celebrate our love affair with beer and hope to share it with you. Herbert B. Friendly. Small town beer, made Friendly!

Started in 2010 as a brew club between two friends, Herbert B. Friendly Brewing went nano in August on 2012 and opened its doors for business in January of 2013. We’re a small family business looking to express ourselves creatively though beer and share it with our local community.

breweries.name: Galaxy Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Galaxy Brewing Co. was founded in 2011 by a local father and son brewing team who are dedicated to producing the finest craft ales. Galaxy Brewing Co. and brewpub represent the culmination of their life long aspiration to deliver quality beer to Binghamton and beyond. We are dedicated to producing the finest craft beer and excellent food using as much locally sourced products as possible. Look for our grand opening in spring of 2012!

Galaxy will be located in the old Phil’s Gift Shop location on the Metrocenter Mall. Our address is 41 Court St/153 & 157 Washington St. Binghamton, NY 13901. We are very proud to be part of the efforts to revitalize Downtown Binghamton and to be able to be in the building that housed such a Binghamton landmark as Phil’s Gifts.

breweries.name: Redhook Ale Brewery
breweries.description: In 1981, Gordon Bowker and Paul Shipman started Redhook Ale Brewery in an old transmission shop in Seattle. Early missteps led to a cult following and eventually led to widespread acclaim that inspired countless craft brewers. Still, more than 25 years later, no brewery has been able to achieve the pure, unqualified Liquid Goodness of Redhook.

breweries.name: Lavery Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Lavery Brewing Company was founded in 2009 by husband and wife Jason & Nicole Lavery. Jason Lynch joined the quest in 2010 to build our own 10 barrel production brewery. Born and raised around Erie, PA, we are all excited to bring something new and dynamic to the local beer culture - Brewing Innovative Ales in Small Batches!

By the way, it's pronounced 'Lav-ry' not 'Lave ry', a soft 'a' in the middle. Similar to 'have', not 'gave', thank you very much.

data.name: Oak Aged Pilot Project
data.description: This beer was created to answer the question:  What would happen if we took one of our favorite recipes and aged it on Riesling oak chips?  The result is a delightful balance of oak, wine and pleasantly soft Belgian esters.  Let us know if you enjoy it as much as we do.  We may make it as a regular offering.

breweries.name: Town Hall Brewery
breweries.description:
The Minneapolis Town Hall Brewery (Town Hall) opened in October 1997 after its founders graduated from business school and spent a couple of years in corporate America.

Town Hall founders Pete and Scot met as seventh graders at Kromrey Middle School in Middleton WI.  At the tender age of 13 both knew what they wanted to do for a living... make and drink good beer.  Just kidding!!

To make a long story short, Pete and Scot spent their formative years playing baseball at the West Middleton Town Hall.  Ever since, the words "Town Hall" evoke memories of community, relaxing with friends and happiness.  When Pete and Scot were reacquainted in Minneapolis they opened the Town Hall.

Tucked away on the fringes of downtown Minneapolis, the Town Hall offers a refreshing alternative to other eating and drinking establishments.  Its relaxed environment attracts a diverse crowd of college students, business people, professors, theater patrons and many more.

The Town Hall makes some of the best beer in America and provides an atmosphere where its patrons can relax and enjoy them.  Please come and taste our award winning beer and fantastic food.  Food and beverages are served in our bar, dining room and lounge.  Outdoor seating is available on our spacious patio from April 1 (weather permitting) until the snow flies in winter.

breweries.name: Uinta Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Named after the only major east-west running mountain range located in the continental U.S., Uinta Brewing Company's journey began in 1993 with the reality that passion for craft beer and a hankering for the great outdoors could align in Salt Lake City, UT.
 
Built on an axis point that endorses sustainability, community involvement and innovation, their compass guides them on a path to admirable, consistent craft beer leading consumers to discover a brand with passion, personality and soul.  Precisely, GREAT BEER is Uinta's True North.

Golden-colored, citrus fruit, spicy, mildly sweet and soft with a hint of oak character.

breweries.name: Upstream Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Derived from the Native American meaning of Omaha,  “upstream” or “against the current”, the Upstream Brewing  Company is just that—a restaurant different from the rest.

Since opening in 1996, the Upstream has been all about fresh—from the handcrafted beers to the locally grown produce to the lively atmosphere. Not to mention the friendly, knowledgeable staff. So stop in today, and find out why we’ve been named one of Omaha’s “Best” several years running.

breweries.name: Flying Dog Brewery
breweries.description:
The Flying Dog Legend begins in 1983, and like every good legend there are several versions of this tale. The villains of the peace in this story are two non-conformist, 'not likely to take it lying down' ranchers named George Stranahan and Richard McIntyre.

As George tells it, he and 11 of his closest friends and family decided to embark on what they called an “amateur mountaineering expedition” to climb K2 in the Himalayas. Under-qualified and unprepared, they started their journey with a Sherpa, a donkey, and a suitcase full of contraband. Naturally, half way through the trip the contraband was gone and the Sherpa and donkey had run off, leaving George and his group to fend for themselves. Luckily, everyone managed to make it off the mountain alive, and with a new outlook on life.

Horn Dog Denver Colorado BeerLike any good beer drinker would at the end of an experience like that, George and his group found a local Pakistani hotel bar to have a drink in. Now, alcohol is banned in most Muslim nations, but if you sign an affidavit stating you are the son of a Christian, it’s like a license to drink. George gladly signed away and got down to some serious drinking. That’s about the time he noticed a painting in the Flashman Hotel of a Flying Dog hanging on the wall that had been drawn by a local artist. Now, we all know dogs don’t fly, but nobody told this particular dog it couldn’t fly, just like no one had told George and his friends they couldn’t make this extraordinary journey. The Flying Dog became a symbol that George and his group used to describe what had happened to them with the mantra, “it is amazing what you can achieve if nobody tells you that you can't.

breweries.name: Von Jakob Brewery
breweries.description:
As Von Jakob Vineyard, we have brought exceptional wines to the Southern Illinois area and beyond for over 15 years. Now, we are excited to introduce Von Jakob Brewery, complete with hand-crafted brews, made exclusively at our Orchard location in Alto Pass, Illinois.

Offering eight styles of beer ranging from our crisp, clean, lightly-hopped American Pilsner to our rich, dark Stout, you are sure to find a beer that delights your palate. Or, if you are having trouble choosing just one, we offer a flight of all eight delicious beers. We also have a great selection of domestic beers as well as premium beers from around the world for your enjoyment.

And for our wine enthusiasts out there, do not worry – our winery isn’t going anywhere. We just thought we would offer you a different libation of choice, should you want to explore it.

We sincerely thank you for your support over the years, and we welcome you to come and experience this next adventure with us!

data.name: Oak-aged Noble Rot
data.description:
Noble Rot is the head-on collision of the beer world and the wine world ... and now we've aged it on oak ... for a whole year!

This saison-esque science project gets complexity and fermentable sugars from the addition of two unique white wine grapes, sourced with our friends at Alexandria Nicole Cellars in Prosser, Washington.

The first addition is the must of viognier grapes that have been infected with a benevolent fungus called botrytis. This 'noble rot' reduces the water content in the grapes while magnifying their sweetness and complexity.

The second is a pinot gris intensified by a process called 'dropping fruit,' where large clusters of grapes are clipped to amplify the quality and distinction of those left behind.

We then aged Noble Rot in one of our oak tanks for an entire year, making for a hazy ale that has a spicy white wine body and a dry, tart finish.

breweries.name: Dogfish Head Craft Brewery
breweries.description: Dogfish Head Craft Brewery makes off-centered ales for off-centered people.  Since 1995, Dogfish has brewed with nonstandard ingredients such as raisins, chicory, maple syrup, and grapes, changing the way people think about beer.  Dogfish believes beer can have as much flavor, complexity, diversity, food-compatibility and ageability as the world's finest wines.  To discover your favorite off-centered ale, visit www.dogfish.com
